Paragraph.Text: send to the Provincial Court the materials specified in paragraph 561(3)(b) of the Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: remove the case from the docket of the court; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where the mode of trial before re-election was trial by judge and jury, notify the High Sheriff in writing that no jury selection will be required.

Section.MarginalNote: Re-Election to Trial by Judge Alone
Section.Text: Where an accused has filed a Notice of Re-Election in accordance with this Rule and the mode of trial reelected is by judge alone, a registry clerk shall:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: endorse the change in mode of trial on the indictment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the High Sheriff in writing that no jury selection will be required.

Section.MarginalNote: Re-Election to Trial by Judge and Jury
Section.Text: Where an accused has filed a Notice of Re-Election in accordance with this Rule and the mode of trial reelected is by judge and jury, or the Attorney General requires pursuant to section 568 of the Code that the accused be tried by a judge and jury, a registry clerk shall:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: endorse the change in mode of trial on the indictment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: place the matter on the next arraignment court list in order to address:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the scheduling or re-scheduling of the trial;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: issues respecting jury selection including the possibility of any challenge for cause; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any orders regarding the summoning of jurors for selection;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notify the parties of the appearance in arraignment court set under clause (b); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: notify the High Sheriff in writing that jury selection will be required.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding anything in this Rule, a judge may require an accused who has indicated an intention to re-elect the mode of trial to appear in person to make his or her re-election.
Where an accused appears in person to make a reelection, the presiding judge

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: may make inquiries of the accused to satisfy the judge that the accused understands the implications of the re-election and has been fully advised concerning the re-election; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall put the accused formally to his or her reelection in the following words or in words to like effect:

Provision.Text: “You have given notice of your wish to re-elect the mode of your trial. You now have the option to do so. How do you wish to re-elect?”

Section.MarginalNote: Challenge for General Lack of Indifference

Subsection.Text: Where an accused is aware of circumstances which might reasonably give rise to an application pursuant to paragraph 638(1)(b) of the Code to challenge for cause every member of a jury panel on the basis of a general lack of indifference, the accused shall:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: give informal notice to the prosecutor as soon as reasonably practicable of those circumstances; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: raise the issue at the pre-trial conference held pursuant to section 625.1 of the Code, propose the questions to be put to each juror, and attempt to reach agreement with the prosecutor on the necessity and details of a challenge for cause procedure, including questions to be posed to prospective jurors.

Subsection.Text: Where at or before the pre-trial conference the accused and the prosecutor reach agreement on the necessity for, and the details of, a challenge for cause procedure, the pre-trial conference judge may make an order to that effect directing the High Sheriff to summon sufficient panels of jurors to accommodate the challenge for cause.
Where by the time of the pre-trial conference the accused and the prosecutor have been unable to agree on the necessity for, or the details of, a challenge for cause procedure:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pre-trial conference judge shall set a time, not later than 30 days following the date of the pre-trial conference, for the filing of an application pursuant to paragraph 638(1)(b) of the Code to determine the challenge for cause issue and may set deadlines for the filing of other materials by the parties; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the accused shall serve and file with the court, together with proof of service, a Notice of Application in CR Form 11.02 in accordance with the schedule so established.

Subsection.Text: An application to challenge every member of a jury panel on the basis of indifference pursuant to paragraph 638(1)(b) of the Code shall include:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an affidavit by or on behalf of the applicant setting out the particulars of the grounds for the challenge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed questions to be put to each prospective juror.

Subsection.Text: The application shall be heard by the trial judge who may hold the hearing prior to the jury panel being summoned.
Where an application is filed under this Rule, the Chief Justice shall designate a judge to be the trial judge.

Section.Text: If the application is granted, the judge shall by order specify the form and content of each question to be put to each prospective juror and who shall ask the questions.

Section.MarginalNote: Leave to File Application to Challenge for Cause

Subsection.Text: A judge may grant leave to file an application pertaining to challenge for cause in accordance with this Rule where a proper explanation for not having made an earlier application is given and good reason is shown that the fair trial of the accused requires consideration of such an application.
Where leave is granted, the judge may:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: set the time for filing and service of the application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: set deadlines for the filing by the parties of other materials in relation to the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: give directions respecting the timing of summoning prospective jurors and the scheduling of the trial.

Heading.Label: RULE 18
Heading.TitleText: Applications for Certiorari, Habeas Corpus, Mandamus and Prohibition

Section.Text: Applications for certiorari, habeas corpus, mandamus and prohibition are governed by the Supreme Court of Newfoundland, Trial Division Rules for Orders in the Nature of Certiorari, Habeas Corpus, Mandamus and Prohibition, SI/2000-33.

Section.MarginalNote: Notice of Application for an Order in the Nature of Certiorari
Section.Text: A notice of Application for an Order in the Nature of Certiorari shall be in CR Form 18.02.

The return of the record under s. 10 of the Supreme Court of Newfoundland and Labrador, Trial Division Rules for Orders in the Nature of Certiorari, Habeas Corpus, Mandamus and Prohibition shall be accompanied by CR Form 18.03.
An order for habeas corpus may be issued in CR Form 18.04.

Heading.Label: RULE 19
Heading.TitleText: Applications for the Reduction in the Number of Years Imprisonment Without Eligibility for Parole

Section.Text: Applications for the reduction in the number of years imprisonment without eligibility for parole are governed by the Newfoundland Rules Respecting Reduction in the Number of Years of Imprisonment without Eligibility for Parole, SOR/89-297.
An application under this Rule shall be in CR Form 19.02A.
These Rules shall come into force on July 1, 2018.

Provision.Text: For forms, see Canada Gazette Part II, SI/2018-43:
